data.content:
noun
[noncount] :a version of the game of pool that is played chiefly in Britain with a cue ball, 15 red balls, and 6 balls of other colors on a table that has 6 pockets - often used before another noun
a snooker player/table - compare billiards, pool
verb
-kers; -kered; -kering
[+ obj] informal
US :to trick or deceive (someone)
She snookered [=hoodwinked] her parents into buying her a new car. - often used as (be) snookered
I have a feeling we've been snookered.
Brit :to prevent (someone) from doing or achieving something
He was ahead early in the match, but he snookered himself. [=he caused his own defeat by performing badly] - often used as (be) snookered
They wanted to build a museum but were snookered [=thwarted] by city regulations.

Tính từ
bị chặn (quả bi a)
(nghĩa bóng) bị đẩy vào tình trạng khó khăn
